results.abstract: Space | In an interview (in German), the cosmonaut Sergei Krikalyov, the human with the most time in orbit, talks about the smell of the universe. "I am not talking about the smell of the capsule, or the spacesuit. I am talking about the universe ... Strangely all cosmonauts say the same thing. We all long for this peculiar metallic smell ... " [NZZ Folio, signandsight]

"I am not talking about the smell of the capsule, or the spacesuit. I am talking about the universe ... Strangely all cosmonauts say the same thing. We all long for this peculiar metallic smell ... " [NZZ Folio, signandsight]

results.abstract: Lofts are coming to Moscow; Krasny Oktyabr chocolate factory, which sits on island in Moscow River, is first old factory building in capital to be converted into apartments; it is icon of Soviet industry and of Russia's transition to capitalism; city planners say that square yard of downtown residential space routinely sells for $20,000 and sometimes for as much as $50,000; photos (M)

headline.main: At Chocolate Factory Site, A New Kind of Luxury Box

results.snippet: MOSCOW -- Perhaps it was only a matter of time, after the sushi bars and the cappuccino bars and the wine bars and the art spaces: Lofts are coming to Moscow.     Here in the capital of the former workers' state, the first old factory building to be...
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- Perhaps it was only a matter of time, after the sushi bars and the cappuccino bars and the wine bars and the art spaces: Lofts are coming to Moscow. Here in the capital of the former workers' state, the first old factory building to be converted into apartments -- with soaring ceilings and gritty details that would make any New York real estate broker tremble -- is an icon of Soviet industry, and of Russia's transition to capitalism.
